e4: Changing to the new policy promotes ethical business practices and enhances transparency in financial reporting. Although there may be initial confusion among some investors, providing accurate and unbiased earnings fosters long-term trust and credibility with the investment community. This shift also mitigates potential legal risks associated with biased reporting, ensuring compliance with regulations.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and fairness in presenting financial information. It should avoid any practices that mislead or confuse investors, ensuring that all stakeholders can make informed decisions. Furthermore, the policy should adhere to regulatory standards and promote accountability within the company, fostering a culture of integrity. Considerations such as the impact on investor trust and long-term company reputation are crucial, as ethical lapses can lead to significant repercussions beyond immediate financial effects.
e6: Yes, I would want to ask how the management plans to communicate the change in policy to both retail and institutional investors to mitigate any potential confusion. Additionally, I would inquire about the measures in place to educate investors on interpreting the new, unbiased earnings reports to ensure a smooth transition and maintain investor confidence.
